intro: Dionysia jamzadiae, commonly known as the Zanzibar dionysia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Zanzibar in Tanzania. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
